verb.description: Have the same opinion about something; concur.
examples: I completely agree with your recent editorial
we both agreed on issues such as tougher penalties for criminals
“Yes, it's dreadful, isn't it,” she agreed
I agree that consumers are always right

verb.description: Consent to do something that has been suggested by another person.
examples: she had agreed to go and see a movie with him
your body language does not agree with what you are saying

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French agreer, based on Latin ad- to + gratus pleasing.
